title: Workflow
text:
This is a Quarto slidedeck.

Create new labs GitHub-Repo
Create new branch gh-pages
Change settings in page: gh-pages and root
Open VS Code
Change Quarto seetings in files
Render all in terminal: quarto render
Push to GitHub

title: Lab
text:
In this case study, you will step into the shoes of a market researcher for an e-commerce company. Your task is to conduct a comprehensive competitive analysis.
You‚Äôll analyze key competitors and examine customer reviews and social media mentions to gauge public sentiment and identify any areas where your company could potentially gain a competitive advantage.
Through this process, you‚Äôll gain practical experience in data collection, quantitative analysis, and critical evaluation skills, which are crucial in strategic decision-making.
For this case study, we will create a fictional scenario where we have three major e-commerce competitors: E-ShopA, E-ShopB, and E-ShopC. We‚Äôll use SQL and Python for data analysis and visualization.

Task description

title: Competitive analysis E-commerce

import mysql.connector

title: Competitive analysis E-commerce
text:
import mysql.connector
import pandas as pd
from keys import *

title: Competitive analysis E-commerce
text:
Data
Connect to your MySQL-database

config = {
  'user': '<username>',
  'password': '<password>',
  'host': '127.0.0.1',
  'database': 'db-ecommerce',
  'raise_on_warnings': True
}

cnx = mysql.connector.connect(**config)


# Create a connection
#cnx = mysql.connector.connect(user='<username>', password='<password>', host='127.0.0.1', database='db-ecommerce')

title: Competitive analysis E-commerce
text:
First analysis


# Average Revenue by E-Shop
df_avg_revenue = pd.read_sql("""
    SELECT eshop_name, AVG(annual_revenue) as average_revenue
    FROM ecommerce_data
    GROUP BY eshop_name;
""", cnx)



# E-Shop with the Highest Average Rating
df_best_rating = pd.read_sql("""
    SELECT eshop_name, AVG(average_rating) as average_rating
    FROM ecommerce_data
    GROUP BY eshop_name
    ORDER BY average_rating DESC
    LIMIT 1;
""", cnx)



# E-Shop Performance Over Time
df_revenue_by_year = pd.read_sql("""
    SELECT eshop_name, YEAR(date) as year, SUM(annual_revenue) as total_revenue
    FROM ecommerce_data
    GROUP BY eshop_name, year;
""", cnx)



# E-Shop with the Most Social Media Followers
df_most_followers = pd.read_sql("""
    SELECT eshop_name, MAX(social_media_followers) as max_followers
    FROM ecommerce_data
    GROUP BY eshop_name
    ORDER BY max_followers DESC
    LIMIT 1;
""", cnx)



# Monthly Active User Base Growth
df_user_growth = pd.read_sql("""
    SELECT eshop_name, DATE_FORMAT(date, '%Y-%m') as month, AVG(active_user_base) as average_active_users
    FROM ecommerce_data
    GROUP BY eshop_name, month;
""", cnx)



# Close the connection
cnx.close()

text:

Calculate the average annual revenue for each e-shop.
